extensionAttribute.displayName: Adobe Creative Cloud - Device License Remaining Days
extensionAttribute.description:
This Extension Attribute determines the expiry date of an Adobe Enterprise Device License serial number and works out how many days are remaining until it expires.
If no serial number is found, the result will have no value.
This Extension Attribute requires the AdobeExpiryCheck binary to work
extensionAttribute.scriptContentsMac:
#!/bin/bash # # Written by Neil Martin - 2018-11-29 # Modified 2019-05-21 - a more elegant way to get the date code from AdobeExpriryCheck - thanks to Kendall Johnson # # This script determines the expiry date of an Adobe Enterprise Device License # serial number and works out how many days are remaining until it expires. # # If no serial number is found, the result will have no value. # # This script requires the AdobeExpiryCheck binary to work # Get it from https://helpx.adobe.com/enterprise/kb/volume-license-expiration-check.html # ########### # # Edit the variables below as needed: # # Set $product to 'Acrobat' for Adobe Acrobat, or 'CreativeCloud' for Creative Cloud # Set $toolpath to the path where the AdobeExpiryCheck binary is installed
product=CreativeCloud toolpath="/usr/local/bin"
# Do not edit below this line
rawdate=$("$toolpath"/AdobeExpiryCheck | grep "$product" | awk '{print $3}')
if [[ "$rawdate" == "" ]]; then echo "<result>""</result>" exit 0 else realdate=$(date -j -f "%Y%m%d" "$rawdate" +'%Y-%m-%d') dateexpires=$(/bin/date -jf '%Y-%m-%d' "$realdate" "+%s") datetoday=$(/bin/date "+%s") echo "<result>$(((dateexpires - datetoday)/86400))</result>" fi
exit 0
